PPMonth.title: The Queen's Birthday
PPMonth.notes: This month's puzzles were written by Game Control members from Austin, DC, Detroit, London, and Portland. Thanks everyone!

puzzle.title: Title Here
puzzle.hint: Bold words in the flavour text are very useful.
"Base" and "six" are the key words here. If it helps, binary is base two.
Visited left bees and right bees are helpful bees.

In base six, a number like 14 is worth ten in decimal. To calculate base six, multiply the first digit by six and add it to the second digit. So 32 would be (3x6)+(2x1)=twenty in decimal. Each hexagonal cell represents a letter in base six. The bees on the bottom left are worth six, on the bottom right are worth one.
Follow the queen bee's path to see what message she's spelling out. The message starts "PUT...."
The message is PUT A RING ON IT SINGER
The solution is BEYONCE.

puzzle.title: Queen's Biggest Fan
puzzle.hint: Look at each plate's border - Notice anything out of the ordinary?
Each plate has morse code in the border.
What could the numbers form when using the "center"?
Create a clock orintation for each plate around the one that is center.
Each fact can be applied to the clock to form a common encoding.
Use semaphore to get final answer.

puzzle.title: Poker Night
puzzle.hint: Perhaps start with the best possible hand and work backwards.
The hands are 2-pair, a straight, a flush, and a 4 of a kind.
Look at the marks on the cards two cards at a time.
Arrange each hand left to right, with rank decending and the suits reverse-alphabetical within cards of the same rank (standard Poker/Bridge suit ranking)

puzzle.title: Pièce De Résistance
puzzle.hint: You want to take turns making normal chess rules and recording them until there's only one piece left
The first four queen moves are: W->C1 B->F5 W->G5 B->E6
The next four queen moves are: W->D5 B->E7 W->D2 B->C5
The final four queen moves are: W->B4 B->F8 W->E7 B->E7
Note the flavortext and the fact that a chessboard has 8 directions you can move any piece.
You'll want to use semaphore where the first flag is the direction of the White Queen's move and the second flag is the direction of the Black Queen's move.

puzzle.title: Drama Queens of Queens
puzzle.hint: Notice there are 15 neigborhoods and 15 people at the party.
Each clue should match up fairly easily with one of the neighborhoods. Googling clue words and/or nieghborhood might help.
The flavortext is cluing you to find the minimum number of intersections you need to traverse to get to the party from each home.
There's an easy way to do this, and know you're right, involving labeling each intersection.
The house in Bay Side requires 9 intersections, yet "Bay Side" only has 7 letters in it. What has 9 letters?
Index the distance into the name to get the letter for each clue.

puzzle.title: Quotable Queens (meta puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Notice the symbols in each corner, and how they are oriented.
There is a familiar similarity among many of the repeated symbols on the page
Have you checked your code sheet?
Look for symbols matching the words in the NATO alphabet on your code sheet
Googling "<queen> <word>" where the word is a word you've found in the puzzle might help you find the right quote.
QUEEN MUM'S QUOTE: That’s the way you should live your life, as it tomorrow you’ll be run over by a big red bus
FREDDIE MERCURY'S QUOTE: I won't be a rock star. I will be a legend.
RUPAUL'S QUOTE: If you don't love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?
QUEEN OF HEART'S QUOTE: Off with her head!
What's left once you've eliminated all the symbols used in all four of the quotes?

puzzle.title: Blockbuster Redux (bonus puzzle)
puzzle.hint: Do any words/phrases stick out to you from within the flavor text?
What could “my favorite song” be referring to?
Keep in mind this month’s theme.
What is the pattern of the numbers/letters on each movie picture?
How do the numbers/letters at the end of each grid row compare to this pattern?
How can these numbers/letters be applied to the song identified?
The song is Bohemian Rhapsody by Queen.
Use the song lyrics to match to the movie scenes provided.
